places.title: Paris, France
places.description: The romantic capital of the world.
places.longDescription: Paris is known for the Eiffel Tower, rich culture, museums, fashion, luxury cafes, and historic architecture.

places.title: Venice, Italy
places.description: The floating city of canals and timeless romance.
places.longDescription: Venice is famous for gondolas, canals, Renaissance architecture, and Italian cuisine.

places.title: Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
places.description: Vibrant beaches, mountains, and carnival culture.
places.longDescription: Rio offers Copacabana, Christ the Redeemer, samba, and breathtaking nature.

places.title: Bangkok, Thailand
places.description: Temples, street food, and vibrant nightlife.
places.longDescription: Bangkok is known for floating markets, spicy cuisine, temples, and nightlife.

places.title: Cape Town, South Africa
places.longDescription: Cape Town offers Table Mountain, penguins, wine regions, and dramatic nature.

places.title: Vancouver, Canada
places.description: A coastal city surrounded by mountains and ocean.
places.longDescription: Vancouver is known for Stanley Park, skiing, multicultural food, and nature.

places.title: Athens, Greece
places.description: The birthplace of democracy and ancient civilization.
places.longDescription: Athens offers Acropolis, Mediterranean cuisine, nightlife, and coastal beauty.

places.title: Sofia, Bulgaria
places.description: A vibrant European capital blending ancient history, cultural landmarks, mountain views, and modern city life.
places.longDescription: Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria, is one of Europe’s oldest cities, offering a unique mix of Roman ruins, historic Orthodox churches, mineral springs, lively boulevards, and a growing modern culture. Nestled at the foot of Vitosha Mountain, the city gives visitors the rare chance to enjoy museums, nightlife, and architecture — then be hiking or skiing within minutes. With affordable dining, friendly locals, and a blend of Eastern and Western influences, Sofia is a welcoming destination for both culture lovers and adventurers.

places.title: Rome, Italy
places.description: Rome, the capital of Italy, is a vibrant city where ancient history and modern life blend seamlessly. Known as the “Eternal City,” it’s home to iconic landmarks like the Colosseum, the Vatican, and winding cobblestone streets full of culture and cuisine.
places.longDescription: Rome is one of the world’s most historically rich cities, with over 2,500 years of art, architecture, and cultural influence. Founded according to legend by Romulus and Remus, it became the heart of the Roman Empire, shaping the politics, engineering, and philosophy of the Western world. Visitors can walk among ancient ruins such as the Roman Forum and the Colosseum, stand beneath the grandeur of the Pantheon, or explore the masterpieces of the Vatican Museums and St. Peter’s Basilica.
